column4: My audio card is not detected! It is on windows but i lost my audio card in kubuntu, kde even prompted me to remove the drivers as they were "no longer necessary"
what could be the possible reasons?
try running: aplay -l
that will list all possible audio devices, or should
Use pastebin.ubuntu.com to show the results
damn, mom calling for dinner, will you still be here in 30 mins?
Perhaps, if not some one else should know. You may also want to try #kubuntu (since ur running that)
ok, i'll be back, thanks :)
back
i'm pasting my aplay -l input now
Try running some of the tests they did on this posting: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1144923 and ok. :)
http://paste.ubuntu.com/345672/
Also "/join #kubuntu" since your using Kubuntu, ubuntu is not the support for this distro specifically. :/
ok i'm posting my problem there too
Ok, I hope they can help you out. I had a client who had an Intel audio chip just like you and it seemed to stop working entirely on 9.10 I think it may be a bug, 9.04 worked perfectly. :(
my chip is intel as well, are you suggesting i change back to 9.04?
Worst case scenario, but you may want to file a bug at launchpad if we can prove it's a bug. See what the other guys say at #kubuntu first.
i still have like 15 updates left tho
i haden't updated for about to weeks... so i don't think the updates where the problem
but anyway, updating could solve it
Hmm yes, running sudo apt-get updates might resolve the issue then
Or just running your default updater application, I believe Kubuntu has one as does ubuntu
yeah it does, i'll see if there is something related with audio in the updates
Ok, gl. :)
